title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 9 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 9 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 9 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 9.

questions.question: Who came to test Solomon with hard questions?
options: Queen of Sheba
Queen of Egypt
Queen of Babylon
Queen of Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: Queen of Sheba
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba came to prove Solomon with hard questions as stated in 2 Chronicles 9:1.

questions.question: What did Solomon do when the queen of Sheba asked him questions?
options: Answered all her questions
Ignored her questions
Answered only some questions
Said he did not know
questions.correctAnswer: Answered all her questions
questions.explanation: Solomon told her all her questions; there was nothing hid from him, according to 2 Chronicles 9:2.

questions.question: What did the queen of Sheba say about the report she heard of Solomon's wisdom?
options: She believed it completely before seeing
She did not believe it until she saw for herself
She heard no report
She thought it was exaggerated
questions.correctAnswer: She did not believe it until she saw for herself
questions.explanation: The queen said she believed not their words until her eyes had seen, as recorded in 2 Chronicles 9:6.

questions.question: How many talents of gold did the queen of Sheba give to Solomon?
questions.explanation: She gave the king an hundred and twenty talents of gold, according to 2 Chronicles 9:9.

questions.question: What kind of trees did Solomon use to make terraces and musical instruments?
options: Algum trees
Cedar trees
Olive trees
Sycamore trees
questions.correctAnswer: Algum trees
questions.explanation: Solomon made terraces and musical instruments from algum trees as stated in 2 Chronicles 9:11.

questions.question: How many talents of gold did Solomon receive in one year?
questions.explanation: The weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and threescore and six talents, as written in 2 Chronicles 9:13.

questions.question: How many targets of beaten gold did Solomon make?
questions.explanation: King Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold as noted in 2 Chronicles 9:15.

questions.question: What material was the great throne made of?
options: Ivory overlaid with pure gold
Silver
Bronze
Wood
questions.correctAnswer: Ivory overlaid with pure gold
questions.explanation: The king made a great throne of ivory and overlaid it with pure gold, according to 2 Chronicles 9:17.

questions.question: How many lions stood on the steps of Solomon's throne?
questions.explanation: Twelve lions stood on one side and the other upon the six steps as described in 2 Chronicles 9:19.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 9:20, some of Solomon's drinking vessels were made of silver.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: All drinking vessels of King Solomon were of gold; none were of silver, as stated in 2 Chronicles 9:20.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon's ships went to Tarshish every three years to bring back precious goods.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The king's ships went to Tarshish every three years bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks, according to 2 Chronicles 9:21.

questions.question: True or False: All the kings of the earth sought Solomon for his riches and not his wisdom.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: All the kings sought Solomon to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart, as noted in 2 Chronicles 9:23.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon had __________ stalls for horses and chariots.
options: four thousand
two thousand
ten thousand
five thousand
questions.correctAnswer: four thousand
questions.explanation: Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots as found in 2 Chronicles 9:25.

questions.question: By what geographical boundaries did Solomon reign over all the kings?
options: From the river to the land of the Philistines and to the border of Egypt
From Egypt to Babylon
From the Mediterranean Sea to the Dead Sea
From the Euphrates to the Red Sea
questions.correctAnswer: From the river to the land of the Philistines and to the border of Egypt
questions.explanation: Solomon reigned over all the kings from the river even unto the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt, as stated in 2 Chronicles 9:26.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 9:31, who succeeded Solomon after he died?
options: Rehoboam
David
Jeroboam
Nathan
questions.correctAnswer: Rehoboam
questions.explanation: Rehoboam, Solomon's son, reigned in his stead after Solomon died, as recorded in 2 Chronicles 9:31.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 9 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 9 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is amazed by someone’s wisdom and blessings. Based on 2 Chronicles 9, what biblical truth would you share about the source of Solomon’s wisdom and riches?
options: God delighted in Solomon and set him on the throne to do judgment and justice
Solomon worked hard without relying on God
Solomon inherited all his wisdom from his father David
Solomon’s wisdom was due to alliances with other kings
questions.correctAnswer: God delighted in Solomon and set him on the throne to do judgment and justice
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:8 teaches that the LORD delighted in Solomon, establishing him as king to do judgment and justice. Verses 22 and 23 highlight Solomon's surpassing wisdom and riches as gifts from God.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 9 encourage us to respond when we receive blessings and wisdom from God?
options: With gratitude and recognizing God’s hand in our lives
By boasting about our achievements
By relying solely on our own strength
By hiding our blessings from others
questions.correctAnswer: With gratitude and recognizing God’s hand in our lives
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba acknowledged in verses 5-6 that Solomon’s wisdom and acts were greater than she had heard, showing recognition and gratitude to God’s work. This models a thankful and humble response.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with doubt about God’s promises. Based on the queen of Sheba’s experience in 2 Chronicles 9, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Seeing with our own eyes can confirm the truth of God’s promises
Doubt is a sign of weak faith and should be ignored
God’s promises are only for a select few
We must test God through our own efforts
questions.correctAnswer: Seeing with our own eyes can confirm the truth of God’s promises
questions.explanation: Verse 6 shows the queen did not believe the reports until she saw Solomon’s wisdom and wealth herself, demonstrating that God’s promises can be confirmed through personal experience and faith.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 9, what does the queen of Sheba’s visit teach us about the fruitfulness of seeking God’s wisdom?
options: It leads to admiration, blessing, and gifts
It leads to envy and competition
It results in isolation from others
It guarantees a life without challenges
questions.correctAnswer: It leads to admiration, blessing, and gifts
questions.explanation: The queen’s admiration (verses 3-7) and generous gifts (verse 9) show that seeking and honoring God’s wisdom brings blessings and fruitful relationships.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s example in 2 Chronicles 9 inspire a work ethic grounded in faith and integrity?
options: Solomon’s diligent building, wise governance, and just reign reflect faithful stewardship
Solomon relied only on others to build his kingdom
Solomon used deceit to gain riches
Solomon neglected justice to increase wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon’s diligent building, wise governance, and just reign reflect faithful stewardship
questions.explanation: Verses 3, 10-12, 25-27 highlight Solomon’s dedicated work in building the temple and palace, managing horses, and maintaining justice—demonstrating faithfulness and integrity.

questions.question: What biblical virtue can be learned from Solomon’s generosity toward the queen of Sheba as described in 2 Chronicles 9?
options: Generosity and hospitality in sharing blessings
Keeping blessings only for oneself
Expecting repayment for kindness
Withholding gifts from visitors
questions.correctAnswer: Generosity and hospitality in sharing blessings
questions.explanation: Verse 12 shows Solomon gave the queen all she desired beyond what she brought, illustrating generous hospitality and stewardship of blessings.

questions.question: A believer feels tempted to seek riches through dishonest ways. How does Solomon’s reign in 2 Chronicles 9 guide us about honest wealth?
options: Wealth gained through God’s blessing and wise management is honorable
Dishonest gain is acceptable if it leads to success
Riches are irrelevant to spiritual life
Only poverty pleases God
questions.correctAnswer: Wealth gained through God’s blessing and wise management is honorable
questions.explanation: Verses 13-14, 22-24 describe Solomon’s vast riches as a result of God’s favor and wise trade, emphasizing integrity in acquiring wealth.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 9, Solomon’s wisdom was so great that all kings of the earth sought his presence to hear it.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 23 clearly states that all the kings of the earth sought Solomon’s presence to hear the wisdom God had put in his heart.

questions.question: True or False: The queen of Sheba was disappointed after seeing Solomon’s wealth and wisdom because it was less than she expected.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 5-6 reveal the queen was impressed and said Solomon’s wisdom exceeded the fame she had heard, so she was not disappointed but amazed.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold, each weighing ______ shekels of gold.
options: six hundred
three hundred
two hundred
one thousand
questions.correctAnswer: six hundred
questions.explanation: Verse 15 specifies that each of the two hundred targets Solomon made weighed six hundred shekels of beaten gold.

questions.question: What does the lavishness of Solomon’s throne and palace furnishings teach about humility and contentment in Christian leadership?
options: True humility includes glorifying God while using gifts responsibly
Leaders should seek extravagance for pride
Contentment means rejecting all material blessings
Leadership requires showing off wealth to others
questions.correctAnswer: True humility includes glorifying God while using gifts responsibly
questions.explanation: Verses 17-20 describe Solomon’s magnificent throne and vessels made of gold, which reflect God's blessings and Solomon’s role to glorify God through wise stewardship, not pride.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s management of horses and chariots in 2 Chronicles 9 relate to stewardship and diligence?
options: He had thousands of horses and chariots well placed in cities, showing careful stewardship
He neglected his army and resources
He wasted resources on unnecessary luxuries
He relied on others without oversight
questions.correctAnswer: He had thousands of horses and chariots well placed in cities, showing careful stewardship
questions.explanation: Verse 25 describes Solomon’s four thousand stalls and twelve thousand horsemen stationed thoughtfully, indicating responsible management of resources.

questions.question: What spiritual lesson can be drawn from the queen of Sheba’s attitude when she came to Solomon with hard questions?
options: Approaching God’s wisdom with humility and sincere inquiry
Challenging God’s servants with pride
Ignoring wisdom and relying on her own understanding
Demanding answers without respect
questions.correctAnswer: Approaching God’s wisdom with humility and sincere inquiry
questions.explanation: Verse 1 shows the queen came to ‘prove Solomon with hard questions’ and communed with him openly, modeling a humble and sincere search for wisdom.

questions.question: Based on 2 Chronicles 9, what can we learn about the importance of sharing God’s blessings with others?
options: Sharing blessings fosters fellowship and honors God
Blessings should be kept private to avoid envy
Only the wealthy should give to others
Blessings are a personal reward, not to be shared
questions.correctAnswer: Sharing blessings fosters fellowship and honors God
questions.explanation: Solomon’s gifts to the queen and the exchange of precious items (verses 9, 12) show that sharing blessings promotes relationships and glorifies God.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 9 teach us about perseverance through trials and trusting God’s plan?
options: Solomon’s reign of forty years shows perseverance and faithfulness to God
God’s blessings come without effort or patience
Trials should be avoided at all costs
Faith is unnecessary for success
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon’s reign of forty years shows perseverance and faithfulness to God
questions.explanation: Verse 30 states Solomon reigned forty years, indicating long-term perseverance and trust in God’s plan for leadership and blessing.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 9 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 9.

questions.question: What was the primary reason the queen of Sheba visited Solomon according to 2 Chronicles 9?
options: To prove Solomon with hard questions
To establish a trade agreement
To marry Solomon
To invite Solomon to her kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: To prove Solomon with hard questions
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:1 states that the queen of Sheba came to prove Solomon with hard questions.

questions.question: How did Solomon respond to the queen of Sheba’s questions?
options: He told her all her questions with nothing hid
He refused to answer her
He answered only some of her questions
He asked her questions in return
questions.correctAnswer: He told her all her questions with nothing hid
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:2 explains that Solomon told her all her questions and nothing was hidden from him.

questions.question: Which aspect of Solomon’s kingdom deeply impressed the queen of Sheba, causing her to be overwhelmed?
options: The wisdom of Solomon and the grandeur of his house
The number of Solomon’s warriors
The wealth of Solomon’s merchants
The size of Solomon’s army
questions.correctAnswer: The wisdom of Solomon and the grandeur of his house
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:3-4 describes how the queen of Sheba was overwhelmed by Solomon’s wisdom and the splendor of his house and servants.

questions.question: What did the queen of Sheba say about the reports of Solomon’s wisdom and acts when she came to see them herself?
options: The reports were true and Solomon exceeded the fame she heard
The reports were exaggerated and not true
She had heard nothing about Solomon before
She found Solomon’s wisdom to be lacking
questions.correctAnswer: The reports were true and Solomon exceeded the fame she heard
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 9:5-6, she admits the reports were true and that Solomon’s wisdom surpassed what she had heard.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 9, what blessings did the queen of Sheba attribute to Solomon’s position as king?
options: Blessed be the LORD thy God who set thee as king to do judgment and justice
Blessed be the king for his military conquests
Blessed be the merchants for their wealth
Blessed be the priests for their wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed be the LORD thy God who set thee as king to do judgment and justice
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:8 attributes Solomon’s kingship to God’s delight and purpose for judgment and justice.

questions.question: What gift did the queen of Sheba give to Solomon?
options: One hundred and twenty talents of gold, spices in great abundance, and precious stones
Thousands of horses and chariots
Silver and fine linen
Ivory and rare animals
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred and twenty talents of gold, spices in great abundance, and precious stones
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:9 details the queen’s gifts of gold, spices, and precious stones to Solomon.

questions.question: What unique wood is mentioned as being brought to Solomon, and what was made from it?
options: Algum trees; terraces and musical instruments
Cedars; the temple roof
Olive wood; chariots
Acacia wood; altars
questions.correctAnswer: Algum trees; terraces and musical instruments
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:10-11 describes how servants brought algum trees which Solomon used for terraces and musical instruments.

questions.question: How often did Solomon’s ships go to Tarshish, and what did they bring back?
options: Every three years; gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks
Every year; spices and precious stones
Every month; horses and chariots
Every five years; timber and metals
questions.correctAnswer: Every three years; gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:21 states that Solomon’s ships went to Tarshish every three years bringing back those goods.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in the description of Solomon's throne with its lions on the sides and steps?
options: Chiasm, emphasizing royal authority and divine protection
Parable, illustrating justice
Allegory, representing Israel
Metaphor, showing strength
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm, emphasizing royal authority and divine protection
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:17-19 shows a chiastic structure highlighting the throne’s design with lions symbolizing power and divine guard.

questions.question: What does the absence of silver vessels in Solomon’s court symbolize in the context of the chapter?
options: Gold was so abundant that silver was considered insignificant
Silver was forbidden by the law
Silver was reserved for the temple only
Silver was less sacred than gold
questions.correctAnswer: Gold was so abundant that silver was considered insignificant
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:20 explains that silver was not accounted of in Solomon’s days, showing gold’s overwhelming abundance.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s wealth and wisdom as described in this chapter foreshadow the ideal king motif found in later biblical literature?
options: Solomon’s unmatched wisdom and riches prefigure the Messianic king
His wealth represents materialism to be avoided
His wisdom is limited to political power
His riches demonstrate God’s rejection
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon’s unmatched wisdom and riches prefigure the Messianic king
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:22-23 show Solomon surpassing all kings, a typology of the coming ideal king in Scripture.

questions.question: What historical context is key to understanding the significance of the queen of Sheba's visit in 2 Chronicles 9?
options: Trade and diplomatic relations between Israel and South Arabia
Military alliances against Egypt
Religious conversion efforts
Migration of peoples into Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Trade and diplomatic relations between Israel and South Arabia
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba’s gifts and camels carrying spices (verse 1 and 9) reflect ancient Near Eastern trade diplomacy.

questions.question: How does the mention of the book of Nathan, prophecy of Ahijah, and visions of Iddo in verse 29 contribute to the authorial intent of this chapter?
options: It anchors Solomon’s reign in prophetic validation and historical record
It suggests Solomon’s reign is fictional
It denies Solomon’s wisdom
It implies Solomon’s reign was brief
questions.correctAnswer: It anchors Solomon’s reign in prophetic validation and historical record
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:29 references prophetic sources, emphasizing divine endorsement and historical reliability.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel for _____ years.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:30 states Solomon reigned for forty years in Jerusalem over all Israel.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 9, Solomon’s reign extended from the river to the land of the Philistines and the border of Egypt.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:26 affirms Solomon’s reign extended from the river to the Philistines and Egypt borders.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 9 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 9 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the primary reason the queen of Sheba came to visit Solomon in Jerusalem?
options: To test Solomon with hard questions
To seek an alliance with Israel
To trade spices and gold
To deliver a message from her people
questions.correctAnswer: To test Solomon with hard questions
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:1 states that the queen of Sheba came to Solomon to prove him with hard questions. This demonstrates the recognition of Solomon's God-given wisdom, resonating with James 1:5 which teaches that God gives wisdom generously.

questions.question: How did Solomon respond to the queen of Sheba's questions?
options: He answered all her questions without anything hidden
He refused to answer some questions
He answered only the easy questions
He asked her to return later for answers
questions.correctAnswer: He answered all her questions without anything hidden
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:2 affirms that Solomon told her all her questions and nothing was hidden from him. This reflects God’s granting of complete wisdom to Solomon (1 Kings 3:12) and parallels Christ as the source of truth (John 14:6).

questions.question: What was the queen of Sheba's reaction after witnessing Solomon's wisdom and the splendor of his kingdom?
options: She was overwhelmed and lost her spirit
She criticized Solomon's wealth
She ignored the display and left quickly
She questioned Solomon's legitimacy
questions.correctAnswer: She was overwhelmed and lost her spirit
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:4 describes that upon seeing Solomon’s wisdom and the grandeur surrounding him, the queen had no more spirit in her, indicating awe and reverence. This aligns with Isaiah 11:2-3 where the Spirit of the LORD brings wisdom and understanding.

questions.question: According to the queen of Sheba, how did Solomon's wisdom compare to what she had heard in her own land?
options: It exceeded the fame that she had heard
It was equal to the reports she heard
It was less than expected
It was fabricated and exaggerated
questions.correctAnswer: It exceeded the fame that she had heard
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:6 records the queen's testimony that half the greatness of Solomon’s wisdom was not told her, indicating that the reality surpassed the reports. This echoes Proverbs 3:13-18, which celebrates wisdom as exceedingly valuable.

questions.question: What blessing did the queen of Sheba pronounce upon Solomon's men and servants?
options: They were happy for standing continually before the king and hearing his wisdom
They were burdened by the king's demands
They were envious of Solomon's wealth
They were ignorant of the king's wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: They were happy for standing continually before the king and hearing his wisdom
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:7 states the queen’s blessing that Solomon’s men and servants who stood before him and heard his wisdom were happy. This highlights the value of hearing godly wisdom, consistent with Psalm 1:1-3 and Colossians 3:16.

questions.question: To whom did the queen credit Solomon’s kingship and wisdom?
options: To the LORD God who loved Israel and set Solomon on the throne
To Solomon’s own strength and intelligence
To the wealth of Israel
To the influence of neighboring kings
questions.correctAnswer: To the LORD God who loved Israel and set Solomon on the throne
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:8 attributes Solomon’s kingship and wisdom to the LORD God, who loved Israel and established Solomon as king to do judgment and justice. This reflects Deuteronomy 17:18-20 and Romans 13:1, teaching God’s sovereign appointment of rulers.

questions.question: What kind of gifts did the queen of Sheba give to Solomon?
options: 120 talents of gold, great abundance of spices, and precious stones
Only spices and precious stones
Only gold and silver
No gifts were given
questions.correctAnswer: 120 talents of gold, great abundance of spices, and precious stones
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:9 records the queen’s gifts as 120 talents of gold, spices, and precious stones, indicating the recognition of Solomon’s God-given blessing. This gifting reflects the biblical theme of honoring God’s anointed (Psalm 72:10-15).

questions.question: What did Solomon use the algum trees brought by his servants and Huram’s servants to make?
options: Terraces to the house of the LORD, the king's palace, and musical instruments
Ships for trade
Furniture for his household
Weapons for the army
questions.correctAnswer: Terraces to the house of the LORD, the king's palace, and musical instruments
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:11 explains Solomon made terraces to the temple and palace, as well as harps and psalteries for singers from the algum trees, highlighting the role of worship and beauty in God’s house, consistent with Psalm 150 and Exodus 15:20.

questions.question: How did Solomon respond to the queen of Sheba’s requests during her visit besides what she had already given him?
options: He gave her all she desired
He refused to give her anything else
He asked her to leave quickly
He gave her only a small gift
questions.correctAnswer: He gave her all she desired
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:12 states Solomon gave the queen all her desire beyond what she had brought, illustrating Solomon’s generosity and the blessing of God’s provision (Luke 6:38, Philippians 4:19).

questions.question: What was the annual weight of gold that came to Solomon?
options: Six hundred and threescore and six talents
Five hundred talents
One thousand talents
Three hundred talents
questions.correctAnswer: Six hundred and threescore and six talents
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:13 records Solomon’s annual gold income as 666 talents, a figure symbolically associated with human limitation and imperfection, which contrasts with divine perfection (Revelation 13:18), underscoring God’s provision to Solomon.

questions.question: What did Solomon make of beaten gold according to this chapter?
options: Two hundred targets and three hundred shields
Just a great throne
Only drinking vessels
No items of beaten gold are mentioned
questions.correctAnswer: Two hundred targets and three hundred shields
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:15-16 describes Solomon’s making of two hundred gold targets and three hundred gold shields, demonstrating the abundance of wealth and the glory of God’s chosen king, paralleling Psalm 45:3-4 about the king’s splendor.

questions.question: Describe Solomon’s throne as detailed in the chapter.
options: A great ivory throne overlaid with pure gold, six steps, gold footstool, stays with lions on each side
A wooden throne without adornments
A silver throne with no steps
A throne made of gold but no lions
questions.correctAnswer: A great ivory throne overlaid with pure gold, six steps, gold footstool, stays with lions on each side
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:17-19 detail Solomon’s throne as ivory overlaid with gold, six steps, footstool of gold, and lions standing by the stays and on the steps, symbolizing royal authority and divine protection as in Revelation 5:5 and Psalm 99:1.

questions.question: What was unique about the drinking vessels and other vessels in the house of the forest of Lebanon during Solomon’s reign?
options: All were made of pure gold; silver was not considered valuable
They were made of silver only
They were made of bronze
They were made of wood
questions.correctAnswer: All were made of pure gold; silver was not considered valuable
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:20 states that all drinking vessels and vessels in the house of Lebanon were made of pure gold, and silver was so common it was not valued, illustrating God’s abundant blessing and the glory given to Solomon’s kingdom, echoing Isaiah 60:5.

questions.question: What was the frequency of the ships of Tarshish bringing goods to Solomon’s kingdom?
options: Every three years
Every year
Every six months
Every ten years
questions.correctAnswer: Every three years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:21 specifies that Solomon’s ships went to Tarshish and returned every three years with gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks, indicating the wide-reaching trade and blessing on Solomon’s reign, consistent with Proverbs 31:14.

questions.question: How long did Solomon reign over Israel according to this chapter?
options: Forty years
Twenty years
Sixty years
Thirty years
questions.correctAnswer: Forty years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 9:30 states Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel for forty years, a period that symbolizes a full and divinely appointed reign, aligning with other biblical reigns such as David’s forty years (2 Samuel 5:4) and Moses’ leadership.
